Description: Green-black serpentine cylinder seal; battle of the gods; a bird-lion pacing towards the right and carrying on its back a bearded god who is wearing a striped skirt and is standing with his left knee raised and his left arm outstretched. Two bearded gods, wearing striped skirts, each grasping the horned head-dress of the other (one of the gods has a multiple-horned head-dress). Bull-man (full-face) with his body turned towards the left; a bearded god, wearing a striped skirt and a multiple-horned head-dress, seizes him by the horn and tail.
Bibliographic references: Collon 1982a / Catalogue of the Western Asiatic Seals in the British Museum: Cylinder Seals II: Akkadian, Post Akkadian, Ur III Periods (137)
Leichty E et al 1988a / Catalogue of the Babylonian Tablets in the British Museum, volume VIII: Tablets from Sippar 3 (p.300)
Boehmer R M 1965a / Die Entwicklung der Glyptik wahrend der Akkad-Zeit
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1977 London, BM, Animals in Art
Acquisition name: From: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge (?)
